metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5391 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
The Linux kernel, versions 3.9+, is vulnerable to a denial of serviceattack with low rates of specially modified packets targeting IP fragmentre-assembly. An attacker may cause a denial of service condition by sendingspecially crafted IP fragments. Various vulnerabilities in IP fragmentationhave been discovered and fixed over the years. The current vulnerability(CVE-2018-5391) became exploitable in the Linux kernel with the increase ofthe IP fragment reassembly queue size.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5391` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-155.205
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-155.205
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-155.205
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-155.205
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-155.205
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-155.205
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-155.205
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-155.205
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-155.205
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-155.205
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-133.159~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-133.159~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-133.159~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-133.159~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-133.159~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-133.159~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-133.159~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-133.159~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-133.159~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1027.30
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-155.205').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
